Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: @Jazzy harassment vs 'ask me questions' is not semantics. It's a fundamental difference in meaning.

Content: Just wanting to be clear about what's being stated here.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: asking people to visit an AMA ... lol

Author: Patziggy#9371
Content: Not a fan of Reddit of their censorship, but for the sake of being forthright d:

Author: Jazzy#0001
Content: Thank you @Patziggy

Author: Patziggy#9371
Content: IMO Reddit keeps the rules vague to serve their interests, but nonetheless this indeed skirts the line for better or worse ü§∑

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: I'll take your advice under consideration for future AMAs. Thank you.

Author: Patziggy#9371
Content: Certainly. With the strength and development behind Komodo something simple like "vote manipulation" on an already censorship-happy platform may give the nay-sayers some unwarranted yet psychologically effective ammo

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: Next time I'll do it without the search URL @Patziggy . We can agree on that.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: is this any different to posting a link to a tweet which has a link to the ama?

Author: Patziggy#9371
Content:
Given that was that was the express purpose for the link format that may bode most favorable. Less about my agreement and more about the stated rules and public optics, yeah?

Ultimately the format and @ everyone is what makes it a toss up IMO. Just my 2 cents and community management experience ü§∑

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator prob not - my mistake was to articulate that an upvote would be appreciated. In future I'll give links but not explicitly say that - only factually state the AMA is going on.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: At the end of the day I am answerable to the community so even if I personally disagree with @Patziggy and @Jazzy I think there is more value in listening than arguing. I want us to work together.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: Also - I am wrong sometimes. I can admit that üòÉ

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: So maybe this is one of those times.

Author: Patziggy#9371
Content:
No argument here, I love Komodo üòÑ

I'm wrong more often than I'm right, so many good heads with good intentions helps us all go further. Thanks for your hard work @benohanlon!

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: fair enough. I understand rules exist, and the potential for bad optics is best avoided.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: yeah - we won't use that tactic again

Author: Jazzy#0001
Content: I think the place to toe the line is generally around asking for upvotes

Author: Jazzy#0001
Content: Linking and notifying people is fine, but the arbitrary line is suddenly crossed when you ask for support

Author: Jazzy#0001
Content: The search URL is actually a good way to mitigating risk around being flagged for this kind of activity and is probably good to maintain

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: I understand you better now @Jazzy and think you're right.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: I can agree on that.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
For business someone's opinion might be less than their own needs and assurance of what one tech solution gives them. Both in short term and long term.
Any major influencers like andreas, vitalik or charlie etc are looked at by those who mostly seek for expert's opinion on subject matters.
I looked at those too at some point. By time I understood the tech and could evaluate myself that their expert view points are not always reliable.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I guess the same case applies to businesses too.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: If they see the Komodo tech useful both in short term and long term for their business, they'll adopt it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: like Linux.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Just takes some time.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I'm not sure I understand what you're saying here. I understand that the big names are not always reliable experts.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: and businesses know this too, which is why firms hire consultants, "expert brain power" for hundreds of thousands of dollars and then sometimes don't take their advice. "experts" aren't always right, but it doesn't mean we shouldn't look to them, even in crypto.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: agree

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: So are you saying getting Jackson to look at Komodo isn't a worthwhile idea?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I guess I'm just trying to understand the flow from Jackson to "their expert view points are not always reliable" haha I'm not trying to argue

Content: that's all

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: right, there is a risk "experts" don't like the tech, but that's the whole point of trying to get objective views, the risk being the objective view isn't favorable, or that it is biased, but that's the risk
